clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolic Phenotyping and Follow-Up of Patients With and Without Diabetes After New Onset of STEMI
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolic Phenotyping and Follow-Up of Patients With and Without Diabetes Mellitus After New Onset of ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) (DISTEMI Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the prospective observational DISTEMI-Study in patients with and without Diabetes mellitus after new onset of ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) aged 18-80 years at inclusion into the study is to characterize in detail the clinical, metabolical, immunological and vascular phenotype, investigate the interplay beween myocardial remodelling and the metabolic phenotype, monitor the progression of the disease and compare the phenotype of STEMI patients with diabetes mellitus to glucose tolerant patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
In detail, the following questions will be answered:
1. Do distinct metabolic phenotypes (with respect to insulin secretion, insulin sensitivity, circulating free fatty acids and ectopic lipid storage, especially in the liver) determine myocardial infarct size and decline of contractile function of the remote myocardium?
2. Which factors modify the progression of the disease (insulin resistance, ectopic lipid storage, subclinical inflammation, abnormal energy metabolism)? Patients are thoroughly examined at baseline and one year after STEMI.
3. Can we identify risk profiles and their relevance for development of diabetes-associated complications as well as long-term progression of diabetes?
4. Can we improve risk assessment algorithms for targeted therapy in line with Precision Medicine?

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of left-ventricular ejection fraction by cardiac magnetic resonance imaging

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of whole body insulin sensitivity with hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp (HEC)
Measurement of beta-cell function with oral and intravenous glucose tolerance test
Measurement of cardiac and hepatic lipid content by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS)
Measurement of liver stiffness by transient elastography (Fibroscan®) and magnetic resonance elastography (MRE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of further cardiovascular diseases (CVD) and any diabetes-associated complication
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of the prevalence of cardiovascular diseases and diabetes-associated complications

arm_group.description: Prospectively followed cohort of patients with new onset of ST-elevation myocardial infarction and diabetes mellitus type 1 or type 2 according to criteria of the German Diabetes Society (DDG) (HbA1c ≥ 6.5 % or orale glucose tolerance test), aged 18-80 years at inclusion into the study

Prospectively followed cohort of patients with new onset of ST-elevation myocardial infarction and normal glucose tolerance (HbA1c < 5.9 % and normal oral glucose tolerance test), aged 18-80 years at inclusion into the study

biospec_descr.textblock: whole-blood, PBMC, serum, plasma, urine, stool

study_pop.textblock:
Maximum care hospital: Department of Cardiology, Pumonology and Vascular Medicine at University Hospital Düsseldorf (UKD), Heinrich Heine University (HHU), Düsseldorf.
STEMI patients are recruited by screening at the German Diabetes Center (GDC/DDZ), Institute for Clinical Diabetology, Leibniz Institute for Diabetes Research at HHU Düsseldorf.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Condition after new onset of ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI)
- Age 18-80 years
- HbA1c < 9.0 %
- Patients with diagnosis of diabetes mellitus according to DDG criteria (i.e. HbA1c ≥ 6.5 % or oral glucose tolerance test)
- Alternatively: Healthy patients with normal glucose tolerance according to DDG criteria (i.e. HbA1c < 5.9 % and normal OGTT)
- Patients capable of giving consent, hemodynamically stable, without sedation (e.g. opiates) or other interfering medication (e.g. catecholamines)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus category 3 A-H (ADA criteria)
- Current pregnancy
- Infective diseases / fever
- Immunsuppressive therapy
- Severe chronic renal, liver or heart disease (e.g. Creatinin ≥ 1.6 mg/dl, peripheral arterial disease stage 4)
- Malignant cancer
- Severe chronic psychiatric illness or addiction
- Participation in an intervention trial
